To do this target selection I combined the following datasets: 
  (1) the "gold" dataset of high-mass WDs identified from the CMD with strong 
	constraints on BP-RP excess factor and RUWE, and
  (2) high-mass WDs identified from the CMD with XP spectra and NO constraints 
	on BP-RP excess factor and RUWE.

This gives the 10 systems listed below. I look at the Aladin
charts for each target in Panstarrs DR1 bands to see if there
is a nearby bright companion. If there is not, then the field 
is clear and it's a possibly good target for observation.

Gaia DR3 Source ID	G-Band Magnitude	RA			Dec			CMD Radius	XP Spec Type	Extra Photometry?	Clear Field
321259125631010688	19.23906898498535	17.00341481267388	35.814406111886065	0.0074817594	--		--			No**
2153552814748001792	19.824588775634766	284.65870302124665	57.78819239158009	0.0067775427	--		ps1			Yes**
3090038517737811712	19.467735290527344	125.10155969827336	1.3826973946792267	0.0074652508	DA		ps1			Crowded		
3121385658671190784	17.237316131591797	92.21438403314589	-0.9974533046455966	0.0046516170	DA		ps1			Probably Yes			
3249027001465705088	18.224544525146484	53.713824909148926	-3.4247499092447784	0.0071986842	DA		ps1			Yes
4248619071266347648	19.120485305786133	301.35106967868836	5.137256051068365	0.0070018846	DA		ps1			Questionable
4750614226039509888	18.58385467529297	46.49363872797763	-47.772247209794116	0.0071774973	DA		des			Yes*
4762592584885748608	19.42276954650879	81.08108195558329	-59.947727725271655	0.0059727301	--		--			Crowded*
5309155039065680512	19.6861629486084	144.35886329588214	-53.31675538451881	0.0065329891	--		--			Crowded*
5924037812888396544	19.57120704650879	258.004079368927	-53.312724938069444	0.0044789894	--		--			Crowded*
* = PS1 imagery isn't available. The associated PNG is in DSS2.
** = Not observable with UVES

======

I think the following targets are the best candidates for a UVES
observing program:

Rank	Gaia DR3 Source ID	G-Band Magnitude	RA			Dec			CMD Radius	XP Spec Type	Extra Photometry?	Clear Field
